children.text: There are gaps in the roof/wall junction where embers may enter in the event of a bushfire.
Australian Standard AS 3959 Construction of Buildings in Bushfire-Prone Areas states that

‘The roof/wall junction shall be sealed, to prevent openings greater than 3 mm, either by the use of fascia and eaves linings or by sealing between the top of the wall and the underside of the roof and between the rafters at the line of the wall’ .
The builder must make these areas comply with the BAL requirements for occupant safety reasons.
